result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian F Sobrofski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions if revoked, consecutive to 14CM1953.
Concurrent with: 14CM1952

Court will consider early termination of probation only after 2 years and with Agent approval.
Concurrent with: 14CM1952.

miscConds.notes:
Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Any remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
DNA Surcharge waived.
No use of possession of any firearms or weapons.

No contact with A.S. unless approved by probation and for purposes of custody and placement of minor children.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Sign any authorizations to be used by the probation Agent.
Complete anger management or domestic violence counseling.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, consecutive to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event:  for the January 22, 2016 Sentencing Hearing filed by Erin Furgason. Original transcript in case #14CM1406.  Remainder are copies.

Defendant Brian F Sobrofski in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER, w/Standard Release Conditions (CREDIT - 0 days)
 Consecutive to 14CM1953; concurrwith with 14CM1952.  


TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);  concurrent with 14CM1952.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Sign any authorizations to be used by the probation agent.
*No contact with:  A. S. unless approved by probation agent and for purposes of custody and placement of minor children.
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Complete anger management or domestic violence counseling.
*No use of possession of any firearms or weapons.

*Court will consider early termination of probation only after two years and with agent approval.

COURT COSTS:  $343 (w/domestic violence surcharge); bail to be applied an refunded to poster.

DNA SURCHARGE:  None.

CONDITION TIME: 20 Days, STAYED, consecutive; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
Sentencing hearing at 01-22-2016 01:30 pm
Sentencing hearing at 01-05-2016 02:00 pm
dated Nov 6, 2015 from Atty Peter Wolff  Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Sentencing hearing at 11-12-2015 02:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian F Sobrofski in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count # 1.  Counts 2, 3, 4, and 5 are dismissed and read in.  Court schedules this for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brian F Sobrofski in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties have recieved the doctor's report.  Defense withdraws not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect plea.  Defense is awaiting a global offer from the State.  Court will set the 14CM1406 matter for trial.  All other cases to follow along for further scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Behavioral Consultants, Inc.
Hearing on July 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Hearing on June 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brian F Sobrofski in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses WCS letter. Defense enters a plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect to all matters.  Court orders examination to be completed and report filed.  Defendant updates phone number.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
from Attorney Wolff entering a plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect and requesting an examination
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brian F Sobrofski in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is working on a global resolution.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date on all matters.  Defense will notify the court if he decides to enter an NGI plea instead.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness in any manor listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.

Defendant Brian F Sobrofski in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED and reserves the right to enter a plea of NGI.  Hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
